titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jacob Ogden promissory note 1977.104
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-21 14:45:48 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A promissory note signed by Jacob Ogden of Queens County, New York, dated June 5, 1759. The note obliges Ogden to repay the loaned sum of 9500 pounds to King George II of Great Britain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jacob Ogden promissory note, 1977.104, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
